article.headline: Yale 74, Cornell 65
article.story: NEW HAVEN, Conn. (AP) -- Eric Flato scored 17 points to help Yale rally from 15 points down to beat Cornell 74-65 on Saturday night. The Bulldogs (13-10, 5-3 Ivy League) shot 60 percent in the second half. Dominick Martin had his second straight double-double for Yale with 14 points and 11 rebounds. Freshman Ross Morin added a career-high 15 points for the Bulldogs. The Big Red (10-12, 5-3) led 65-63 with 4:21 left, but missed their last seven shots. Flato's 3-pointer with 3:44 left gave Yale the lead for good at 66-65. Yale then iced it from the free throw line, making 8-of-8 in the final 3:17. Jason Hartford was 7-of-8 from the field and led Cornell with 21 points. Adam Gore added 18 and Andrew Naeve had 10 points and 10 rebounds.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
